str2: Then, thereafter, afterwards. From epi and eita; thereafter.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
From epi and ano; up above, i.e. Over or on.
Five hundred. From pente and hekaton; five hundred.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Once, once for all; at once. From epi and hapax; upon one occasion.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From keimai; to put to sleep, i.e. to slumber; figuratively, to decease.
